**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:

> Uncomment only one, leave it on its own line:
>
/kind feature


A new API TokenRequest has been implemented.It improves current serviceaccount model from many ways.https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/58790
I think we need some kind measure to limit the range of token expiration.
Try to imagine two cases:
1. User requests a token with extreme short-expiration, say 1s. Then token rotation will be triggered every second which is unacceptable
2. User requests a token with extreme long-expiration, say 100 years. It is almost  permanent．

So I think we need some kind of mechanism to limit the range of token expiration time.
From my point of view,  I can think tow ways to implement.
1. Add a option to api-server, it controls the range of all token request through the cluster.
2. Add an attribute to serviceaccount object, it controls only its own token request.
